name: Viburnum opulus
Relationship: Compare: VIBURNUM PRUNIFOLIUM - Black Haw - (habitual miscarriage; AFTER-PAINS; cancer of the tongue; obstinate hiccough; supposed to be a uterine tonic. Morning sickness; menstrual irregularities of sterile females with uterine displacements.) CIMICIF.; CAULOP.; SEP.; XANTHOX.

Head: Sore feeling in eyeballs
Severe pain in temporal region
Vertigo; feels as if falling forward
Irritable
Rectum: Stools large and hard, with cutting in rectum and soreness of anus
Modalities: Better: in open air and resting
Urine: Cannot hold water on coughing or walking
Female: Pains from back to loins and womb worse early morning
Faint on attempting to sit up
Menses TOO LATE, SCANTY, LASTING A FEW HOURS, offensive in odor, with crampy pains, cramps extend down thighs
Ovarian region feels heavy and congested
Aching in sacrum and pubes, with pain in anterior muscles of thighs ; SPASMODIC AND MEMBRANOUS DYSMENORRHEA
FREQUENT AND VERY EARLY MISCARRIAGE, causing seeming sterility
Extremities: Stiff, sore feeling in nape of neck
Feels as if back would break

details: A general remedy for cramps. Colicky pains in pelvic organs. Superconscious of internal sexual organs. Female symptoms most important. OFTEN PREVENTS MISCARRIAGE. False labor-pains. Spasmodic and congestive affections, dependent upon ovarian or uterine origin.
